title: GEO WEEK
description: Geo Week is the premier event for increased integration between the built environment, advanced airborne/terrestrial technologies, and commercial 3D technologies. It was created as a response to the changing needs of built world and geospatial professionals, and to acknowledge the convergence of technology taking place currently.

title: CIOB: Finding Your Niche in the Construction and Built Environment Field
description:
Explore the Diverse Specializations Within the Construction and Built Environment Industry!

Are you a construction student or young professional curious about the multitude of career paths beyond traditional on-site or office roles? Join CIOB's upcoming webinar, "Finding Your Niche," where you'll delve into the expansive sectors within the construction and built environment industry.

Many individuals studying construction management, civil engineering, and quantity surveying might associate the industry solely with on-site work or consultancy. However, there's a world of opportunities beyond these common areas. Professionals can specialize in diverse fields, including facilities management, property, maintenance, energy and petroleum, and mechanical, electrical, and plumbing (MEP) engineering.

Discover the possibilities of working with entities such as government agencies, government-owned corporations, higher institutions, and commercial entities like banks, restaurants, and stores. Our webinar aims to encourage and assist students and young professionals in identifying their ideal specialization early in their careers.

Don't miss the chance to gain valuable insights that can shape your future in this dynamic field!

title: Africa Energy Indaba
description: The Business Meeting of Choice for the African Energy Sector. The Africa Energy Indaba Conference will discuss, debate and seek solutions to enable adequate energy generation across the continent. The Africa Energy Indaba 2024 will be a physical in-person event, with all conference sessions, side events and the exhibition taking place at the Cape Town International Convention Centre, South Africa.

title: CIOB Student Festival 2024
description:
The CIOB Student Festival 2024 is your platform for inspiration, celebration, and knowledge-building.

Join the global student community in this exciting two-day event where you'll gain invaluable insights from industry and academic leaders and where you will be able to learn and participate in an interactive way. Get ready to embark on a journey filled with personal reflections, industry best practices, and guidance for your future career.

By participating in this immersive experience, you can enhance your competence, boost your confidence, and expand your knowledge of the built environment sector. Develop practical skills, industry know-how, and gather expert advice that will set you on the path to excellence in your future career.

The impressive lineup of speakers offers you an inspiration, the chance to ask questions, engage actively with like-minded people and make the most of this dynamic learning opportunity. Join in in celebrating your potential, igniting your passion for the industry, and innovating your future. CIOB Student Festival 2024 - where knowledge knows no bounds!

title: US-Africa Green and Sustainable Financing Workshop
description:
The United States Trade and Development Agency (USTDA), in collaboration with the African Development Bank Group, will host the US-Africa Green and Sustainable Financing Workshop in Abidjan, Côte d’Ivoire from 19-20 March 2024.

The workshop will showcase innovative financing models being deployed by USTDA, the Bank, and other leading institutions to bring sustainable infrastructure projects to fruition. It will convene industry leaders to discuss the environment that enables green and sustainable financing across the African continent. US technical experts and key regional financiers will highlight market-leading case studies of successful sustainable finance transactions.

Public and private sector stakeholders will share knowledge, exchange ideas, and catalyze partnerships to mobilize financing for green and sustainable infrastructure projects across Africa. Speakers will include representatives from US government agencies, regional development finance institutions, regulators, and stock exchanges and the African Development Bank.

Topics of interest to stakeholders will include:

  • Green and sustainable infrastructure projects
  • New renewable energy funding models
  • Financing mechanisms
  • Regulatory and policy reforms
venue_address: Sofitel Abidjan Hotel Ivoire, Bd Hassan II, Abidjan

title: CIOB: Construction Site Organization Process and Efficiency
description:
Get ready for the second episode of CIOB's Academic Webinar Series - Sub Saharan Africa Edition, featuring a special guest speaker, Hervé Yimgna Mengouo.

Hervé Yimgna Mengouo is a seasoned professional with expertise in Sustainable Construction, BIM Site & Construction Management, and extensive research in Construction Site Organization. With dual certifications as MCIOB and MRICS, Hervé brings a wealth of knowledge and practical insights to the construction industry.

As a distinguished Sustainable Construction Site Manager, Lecturer, and Researcher, Hervé will delve into the intricacies of Construction Site Organization Process and Efficiency, focusing on Site Organization (SO) and Efficient Installation Work Package (IWP).

Don't miss this opportunity to gain valuable insights into construction site efficiency and organization.

title: CIOB Work Readiness Symposium - Durban University of Technology
description:
This symposium aims to bridge the gap between industry professionals and the aspiring talents of the built environment field. 

CIOB's symposium will bring together esteemed built environment professionals from Durban, renowned for their expertise and experience in various sectors of the industry. They will be delivering insightful talks and sharing valuable knowledge with the attending-built environment students.

The symposium offers a unique opportunity for students to gain valuable insights into the industry, learn about emerging trends, and understand the practical aspects of their future careers. It serves as a platform for students to engage with professionals, ask questions, and gain a deeper understanding of the challenges and opportunities that lie ahead.

Through interactive sessions, panel discussions, and networking opportunities, attendees will have the chance to connect with industry leaders, establish valuable connections, and explore potential career paths within the built environment sector.

title: TechCIOB – Application workshop
description:
CIOB's Technical Member grade (TechCIOB) may be for you if you have a level 4 (for example, NVQ4, BTEC) construction-related qualification and three years of experience working in a technical role within construction or a level 3 construction-related qualification and five years of experience working in a technical role.

From Building Control Technicians and Site Supervisors to BIM Technicians and off-site manufacturing roles, CIOB Technical Membership helps empower and highlight your skillset.

This workshop will cover

  • Navigating Moodle
  • The right approach for completing the report template
  • The Competencies
  • How to upload your submission
  • Your result
  • What happens next?

title: UK Construction Week 2024
description:
UK Construction Week is the UK's largest trade event for the built environment which

connects the entire construction supply chain and promotes industry growth. You will

gain access to products, live demos, seminars, and network with representatives from

major infrastructure projects in both the public and private sectors.

What’s in it for you? 

- Generate leads from a pre-qualified audience through peer-to-peer networking and

direct engagement with potential clients.

- Gain unparalleled exposure and amplify your businesses at a dedicated Ghana

Pavilion. Visitors will include major contractors, government officials, builders,

developers, architects, suppliers, contractors, and more.

- Tap into and harness purchasing power of over £1m+ and gain access to

seminars and live product demonstrations.

- Participate in B2B and B2G meetings, and networking receptions with onsite

administrative support.

Who should attend? 

Construction consultants, contractors, architects, project managers, developers,

engineers, buyers, and manufacturers should attend.

title: Low Carbon in Real Estate for Sustainable Development
description:
Welcome to the Low Carbon in Real Estate for Sustainable Development Guest Lecture, proudly hosted by Cape Coast Technical University in Ghana! CIOB invites you to join online on Friday, May 17, 2024, at 11:00 AM SAST for an enlightening discourse delivered by Professor Tang from Tongji University. 

Together, you'll explore how the real estate industry can actively contribute to fostering a more sustainable future. This lecture promises to delve deep into innovative strategies, best practices, and emerging trends aimed at reducing carbon footprints and promoting sustainable development within the realm of real estate. 

Don't miss this opportunity to gain valuable insights and be part of the transformative conversation shaping the future of our built environment. Mark your calendars and secure your virtual seats for what promises to be an insightful and thought-provoking session.

title: Challenges with BIM: Adoption from a Canadian perspective
description:
Join CIOB for yet another Guest lecture exploring Building Information Modeling. BIM, a revolutionary technology in the construction industry, offers numerous benefits such as improved collaboration, enhanced project visualization, and cost savings. 

About the Speaker:

Hamza Momade MCIOB is a Civil Engineer with a Doctorate degree specializing in building productivity models using artificial intelligence tools. A Mozambican by heart, he has worked as a PM in Malaysia, Singapore, and at present Canada on residential, commercial, and industrial projects with overall experience of 11 years. He has worked closely in creating policies and implementing quality processes and project management software (Procore, virtual reality 3D modelling, HCSS, Sitedocs, Jibble) to improve overall production, document control, and make firms more competitive.

He currently volunteers as Tomorrow Leaders Chair with CIOB, Toronto, the current chair of PMI Lakeshore (Construction), and a committee member with ICE and RICS. He works as a PM for Roni Group (Earthwork specialist) and is a part-time professor at Durham College teaching construction management courses. His research publications focus on improving construction productivity levels, sustainable construction practices, and understanding construction technology challenges and can be read at Google Scholar. He is a Chartered Member of CIOB, RICS, a Professional licensed Engineer in Canada/Portugal, Project Management Professional, and is a Distinguished Toastmaster.

Hamza is a strong believer in challenging the status quo and continues to question the norms inspiring to push the boundaries.

title: Get To Know CIOB - Johannesburg networking event
description:
Join CIOB in person at the event located in Sandton for a night of networking and connecting with fellow professionals in the construction industry. This is a great opportunity to meet members of the Chartered Institute of Building (CIOB) and learn more about what they do.

The networking session presents an excellent opportunity for you to meet fellow industry experts, share experiences, and explore potential collaborations that can drive innovation and growth in our sector. Additionally, you will have the chance to learn more about CIOB's mission, vision, and ongoing initiatives, and engage with key figures such as the CEO, Dr. Caroline Gumble, and CIOB Education and Standards Director, Rosalind Thorp.

Your presence at this event will greatly contribute to the exchange of ideas and the strengthening of our industry community. Your perspective and expertise are highly valued, and CIOB would be honored to have you join in.
venue_address: DaVinci Hotel and Suites on Nelson Mandela Square

title: Africa Hospitality Investment Forum (AHIF) 2024
description: Attended by the highest caliber international hotel investors of any conference in Africa, AHIF is the leading hospitality investment conference that connects business leaders from the international and local markets, driving investment into tourism projects, infrastructure and hotel development across Africa.

title: UKGCC Webinar Invitation: Deriving Value from Good ESG Practice
description:
You are invited to participate in the UK-Ghana Chamber of Commerce’s upcoming webinar with KPMG Ghana on "Deriving Value from Good ESG Practice: A Win-Win for Businesses and Communities”.

The webinar will explore how businesses benefit from ESG, including reduced costs, enhanced brand reputation, improved employee morale and stakeholder relations.  Additionally, the webinar will examine how the communities within which business operate, can benefit from environmental protection and improved socio-economic well-being. 

The panel will also discuss challenges in implementing ESG practices and how to overcome them.


Who may participate

  • UKGCC member companies
  • Business executives
  • C-suite leaders
  • Senior managers
  • Decision-makers responsible for ESG strategy and reporting.
  • The public

What's in it for you

  • Increased understanding of how businesses can create their own ESG narrative by setting smart goals and identifying the right factors and targets to communicate to.
  • Increased awareness of the most important ESG metrics to investors, consumers, and employees, and how businesses can effectively communicate their activities transparently.
  • Increased knowledge on how strong ESG practices lead to increased profitability and sustainable business models.

title: Supporting Services for Trenchless Installations
description:
Installation of sewer systems in South Africa’s urban areas probably started in earnest during the 1940s and 50s. Designers predicted that sewers would have a design life of 40 years. Little was understood about concrete sewer corrosion and nothing about their rehabilitation.
 
During the early 1950s the problem of concrete sewer corrosion became a matter of serious concern. At an Institution of Municipal Engineer’s conference it was decided to research the problem. Together with the South African Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), a research project to study concrete sewer corrosion was initiated.
 
The output showed that using calcareous aggregates significantly reduced the corrosion rate. Since the mid-1960s this became the standard aggregate used for sewers. However, the significance of replacing or rehabilitating them after 40 or 50 years of use was not appreciated.
 
The webinar on August 20th will cover the supporting services required during rehabilitation. The presenters all have years of experience in their fields of activity and have been involved with the rehabilitation of the Cape Flats outfall sewers, the largest sewer rehabilitation project undertaken in South Africa.


Presenters
 

* Overview of why rehabilitation is required – Alaster Goyns
* Consultant’s role on pipeline rehabilitation – Herman Geldenhuys of Ingerop
* Over pumping and pipe cleaning – Justin Spreckley of Mainline
* Manhole rehabilitation and replacement – Henry Abel of Nenjeni & John Davies of John Davies Pipeline Services will provide details – Alaster Goyns will present

 
SASTT has ECSA accreditation to issue CPD points. For this 2½ hour webinar there will be 0,25 points. The attendance fee will be R600 for SASTT members and R700 for non-members.
 
Anyone interested in attending should contact Rina Stead for registration and payment details:
Cell: 081 541 0100 or e-mail: director@sastt.org.za

title: West African Energy Summit
description:
The West African Energy Summit provides a platform where energy project owners can converge to raise capital for game changing projects, and where operators engage in transformative upstream deals from ‘farm-in’ opportunities to obtaining new licenses.

As an attendee/sponsor, you will benefit from exposure to international partners and capital. You will also benefit from job creation opportunities.

Oil and gas operators, exploration companies, asset managers, corporate investors, investment banks…and more may attend.

For more information, contact: saraadelaide@ukgcc.com 

For sponsorship opportunities, visit https://ukgcc.com.gh/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/West-African-Energy-Summit-2024-Brochure-1.pdf
venue_address: Accra International Conference Centre, Castle Rd

title: CIOB ACADEMIC SUMMIT: Creating An Inclusive Global Community
description:
CIOB is pleased to launch its annual CIOB Academic Summit on Tuesday 10 September 2024.

This accessible virtual conference will lead the way to transform academics and connectability on a global scale - leading the way for cross-collaboration, sharing of cutting-edge research, knowledge, education, and most importantly building a strong sense of community. This conference will aim to create a community that problem-solves and creates partnerships through engaging discussions.

The summit aims to bring together academic leaders, researchers, policymakers, and professional services staff within the built environment education arena, to share knowledge, and evidence agility, innovation, and inclusivity.

Why should you attend?

• The summit will bring together a global representation of education institutions from the CIOB network and wider.

• Lead the conversation, share your research, policies, and thought leadership with an engaged audience on topics including:

- Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion

- Ethics

- Quality & Safety

- Future of Construction

- Skills Gap

- Environmental Sustainability

- Health and Wellbeing

• Network and meet like-minded academics, researchers, and practitioners

• Hear case studies of best practices in student experience, industry partnerships, and research impact

• It will be the place to share ideas, research interests, and discover new collaborative opportunities

• Discover learning and teaching best practices for an increasingly digital-first learner mindset

• Join the CIOB academic community and actively support the transformation of the built environment education and the sector in general.

title: Big 5 Construct Nigeria
description:
The construction industry in Nigeria is anticipated to grow at a CAGR of 2.4% between 2024 and 2028 (Source: ABIQ), thanks to the government’s focused infrastructure development strategies and support. Prioritizing economic development, public and private investment in the housing sector, and strengthening external demand, Nigeria’s government is reshaping the industry and the future of the country. Tapping into opportunities emerging from ongoing and upcoming projects in the country is the 4th edition of Big 5 Construct Nigeria, taking place from 24 - 26 September 2024 at the Landmark Centre in Lagos.

The event is expected to host more than 9,000 professionals and 150 exhibitors from 20 countries. As the largest construction trade exhibition to date in Lagos, Big 5 Construct Nigeria connects industry professionals to opportunities and partnerships. 

Within the event, construction industry professionals will engage in 25 CPD-certified Big 5 Talks under the themes of architecture & design, facilities management, project management, quantity surveyors, technology and sustainability. More than 30 speakers will provide valuable insights on the sector’s opportunities and challenges, with some of the key topics of discussion being project financing and the importance of cost management, stakeholder communication and collaboration, positive impact of BIM implementation and tech trends in Nigerian construction, among others.

Why You Should be a part of Big 5 Construct Nigeria: 
• Thousands of buyers, specifiers, and industry professionals sourced the latest products and solutions directly from top local and international exhibitors in 2023. 
• The CPD-certified Big 5 Talks attracted 3,572 attendees, advancing their training and career goals. 
• 97% of visitors reported that attending the event is crucial for their business.

title: 2024 Africa Investment Forum
description:
The Africa Investment Forum is a multi-stakeholder, multi-disciplinary platform that advances projects to bankable stages, raises capital, and accelerates deals to financial closure. Its vision is to channel capital towards critical sectors to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals, the African Development Bank’s High 5s and the African Union’s Agenda 2063.

Since it was launched in 2018, the Africa Investment Forum has mobilised nearly $180 billion in investment interest. Its centrepiece is the annual three-day Market Days event, which brings together thousands of global investors, heads of development finance institutions, and business and government leaders to advance critical investment transactions to closure.

title: AFSIC - Investing in Africa 2024
description:
Since 2013, AFSIC – Investing in Africa, Africa’s investment event is the meeting place for focused networking, discussions and executing African investment deals. It has delivered year on year growth and successes for both companies seeking funding with Africa- focused investors and companies wanting to grow globally. 

AFSIC – Investing in Africa continues to drive investment into Africa, building a strong economic, sustainable and innovative future.  

Join us in London 7th – 9th  October 2024 to continue these successes and ensure investment continues to transform Africa. 

AFSIC conference content is made up of industry and country focused streams comprising solos, panels and quickfire pitch sessions. 

Enhanced networking opportunities are planned for 2024 with structured sessions allowing delegates to meet the wide variety of excellent investors attending. Meet the Development Finance Institutions (DFIS), Meet the VC Investors and Meet the US Investors being some of the most anticipated sessions by businesses looking to raise capital. 

Quickfire sessions offer some of Africa’s most interesting businesses and funds listed on our African Investments Dashboard the opportunity to make a quick presentation to delegates outlining the key merits of their investment proposition. The African Investments Dashboard is a platform that successfully matches business and investment opportunities on the Africa continent. The conference will be showcasing many exciting investable projects on site in our AFSIC 2024 Deal Book containing Africa’s most exciting investment opportunities and in our investor focused Quickfire pitching sessions. 

At AFSIC 2024 there will be over 20 free flowing Country focused sessions. The sessions will allow delegates to find out more about the regulations and investment climate of particular countries as well as be exposed to attractive investment opportunities within a specific country. The Country-Investment Summits are expanded in 2024 to deep dive into the macro and micro investment climates of many of Africa’s largest and fastest growing economies. 

AFSIC 2023 will provide unparalleled opportunities to network and develop strong business relationships with investors, financial intermediaries, and African business leaders through an array of multiple presentation and panel streams, discussions, networking events, exhibition stands, business match-making meetings and seminars. 

AFSIC has for the past ten years delivered year on year growth and success for companies seeking funding and companies wanting to grow globally. AFSIC’s 2024 aims to deliver even more diverse interested investors, exceptional content, unparalleled access to exceptional investment opportunities and more business networking than any other Africa investment-focused conference.

title: IRF World Congress 2024
description:
The IRF World Congress, held every four years, is a prestigious global event that celebrates the road and mobility sectors as critical drivers of economic growth and development. For nearly seven decades, it has provided a platform for industry leaders, policymakers, and experts to collaborate, share insights, and foster partnerships. The upcoming edition of the IRF World Congress will take place from October 15-18, 2024, in Istanbul, Türkiye. This event will feature a comprehensive technical program, a large exhibition, and technical site visits, offering participants the chance to explore cutting-edge solutions in road infrastructure and mobility.

Under the theme "Connecting to Empower Mobility: Roads as Enablers of a Sustainable Future for All," the congress will address key road and mobility sector challenges, highlighting their role in sustainable development. The event will bring together global leaders, industry experts, academics, and civil society to discuss innovative strategies that promote inclusive and sustainable transportation systems, emphasizing accessibility and mobility for all, whether in urban or rural settings.

The IRF World Congress 2024 promises to be a transformative event that will pave the way toward a more sustainable, inclusive, and connected future in global transportation.

title: METALCON
description:
METALCON is the largest international event in the metal construction and design industry. Established in 1991, it’s the only annual tradeshow and conference devoted exclusively to the application of metal in the building envelope. 

Contractors, architects, developers, owners, fabricators, manufacturers, suppliers and distributors from 45+ countries gather to explore the latest products, solutions, opportunities and innovations related to the use of metal in design and construction. 

The conveniently combined tradeshow floor, education learning centers and demo areas make it easy to discover the innovations to make your business more competitive, efficient and profitable while advancing your knowledge and skills. 

Join us in Atlanta, GA USA October 30th-November 1st to experience all METALCON has to offer. Register here: https://xpressreg.net/register/metl1124/attendee/

title: Leveraging Technology to Overcome Challenges in the African Construction Industry
description: Discussions will center on the role of technology in improving efficiency, productivity, and safety in construction projects.

title: Cote D'Ivoire Build Expo
description:
Build Expo brings together the full construction sector including thousands of industry professionals and leading construction companies to connect and do business.

African countries have been heavily investing in construction projects, both infrastructure, and superstructure. The construction industry is one of the rapidly growing sectors in the continent and it greatly contributes to employment. Thanks to the population increase and urbanization in the continent, the strong growth of the construction sector is inevitable.

West Africa Build Expo spotlights Côte d’Ivoire’s growing construction sector and uniting industry leaders.

Secure your stand at the 2025 edition and get ready to grow your business.
venue_address: Abidjan Exhibition Centre (Parc des Expositions d'Abidjan)

title: Big 5 Construct Ethiopia 2025
description:
The largest gathering in Ethiopia for construction professionals.

Position your brand in front of the local contractors, distributors and government stakeholders.

Gain insights into local regulations and build new business partnerships in Ethiopia's growing construction market worth $67 billion.

title: Big 5 Construct Nigeria 2025
description:
The largest gathering in Nigeria for construction professionals.

The exhibition is expected to bring together 9,000+ attendees and more than 150 exhibitors from 20+ countries in Lagos, Nigeria this September, featuring cutting-edge products, innovations and solutions.

The event will feature dynamic displays of advanced equipment, emerging innovations and groundbreaking technologies. 

Gain insights into local regulations and build new business partnerships in Nigeria's emerging market worth $108 billion.

title: Big 5 Construct Kenya 2025
description:
Your gateway to Kenya’s construction industry.

  • Discover Innovative Products:
    Explore cutting-edge solutions from top manufacturers, distributors, and service providers to meet your project needs.
  • Connect with Industry Experts:
    Build valuable relationships with contractors, engineers, architects, developers, and more.
  • Attend CPD-Certified Big 5 Talks: Gain insights into the latest trends with 20+ CPD-certified sessions on Architecture, Project Management, and more.

Gain insights into local regulations and build new business partnerships in Kenya's emerging construction market worth $20 billion.

title: Big 5 Construct Egypt 2025
description:
Egypt's Most Influential Construction Event: Showcasing Innovation and Forging Strategic Partnerships

  • Showcase your services or launch products to a targeted audience of 20,000 professionals actively seeking your solutions.
  • Generate leads that result in tangible opportunities and real ROI from new customers in Egypt’s $570bn construction market.

Under the patronage of the Ministry of Housing, Utilities & Urban Communities, the 6th edition of Big 5 Construct Egypt was a resounding success. Over 18,258 construction experts and more than 287 exhibitors from 20 countries participated, showcasing cutting-edge innovations and technologies in the construction sector.

The event fostered business networking and stakeholder collaboration, resulting in the formation of new strategic partnerships. Live demonstrations captivated visitors and opened doors to significant business opportunities through the latest technological advancements.

title: Big 5 Construct South Africa 2025
description:
Find new business opportunities in South Africa’s $125 billion construction market

  • Gain insights into local regulations and build new business partnerships
  • Showcase your brand amongst the local contractors, distributors, architects, engineers, and government stakeholders
  • Network with decision-makers who are on the lookout for the latest products, technologies and innovations
  • Connect with potential clients, ensuring your business stays ahead in the competitive construction market of South Africa

title: Unlocking Investment in Green Construction Projects in Sub-Saharan Africa
description:
The fourth webinar in our "Building a Better Africa" series, "Unlocking Investment in Green Construction Projects in Sub-Saharan Africa," offers an in-depth look at the exciting opportunities and challenges of sustainable development in this vibrant region. As the demand for eco-friendly infrastructure grows, understanding the nuances of investing in green construction is more important than ever. 

This webinar will provide you with expert insights from industry leaders and highlight innovative strategies for attracting and managing investments in green projects. Attendees will gain a deeper understanding of the unique opportunities and challenges faced in Sub-Saharan Africa, a region with immense potential for sustainable growth. 

You will also have the chance to engage directly with our panelists during an interactive Q&A session, making this event an invaluable resource for investors, construction and real estate professionals, policymakers, environmental advocates, and anyone interested in the future of green construction in Sub-Saharan Africa. 

Click the button on the left to Register now!

title: Railway Infrastructure Development in Africa
description:
Join us as we explore the pivotal role of railway infrastructure in transforming transportation across Africa. Despite its significant contribution to the economy and regional connectivity, there are still challenges hindering the continent's railway potential.

ConstructAfrica proudly presents the Railway Infrastructure Development in Africa Webinar, scheduled for June 20th, 2024. This virtual event, hosted on Zoom as part of our Building a Better Africa webinar series, aims to address these challenges head-on.

This webinar will convene 150+ policymakers, project owners, industry experts, and thought leaders to exchange insights and strategies for developing, constructing and managing railway infrastructure across the continent. Together, we'll explore the latest best practices and innovative solutions driving Africa's railway development forward.

Our discussions will revolve around crucial topics including:

  • Modernising legacy rail systems
  • Successfully delivering cross-border rail projects
  • Financing rail projects
  • Making PPPs work in the rail sector
  • Delivering inner city rail
  • Technology   

Don't miss this opportunity to be part of shaping the future of railway infrastructure in Africa. Register now to secure your spot at the forefront of this transformative dialogue.

title: Innovative Construction Materials for Africa
description:
Join us as we delve into the world of innovative construction materials for Africa. Discussions will center on cutting-edge materials and technological advancements tailored to the unique landscape and needs of construction in Africa. 

After this webinar, you will have a wealth of actionable insights and invaluable knowledge that will change the way you impact the construction industry in Sub-Saharan Africa and beyond. Get ready to gain a comprehensive understanding of the transformative potential within Africa's construction sector. 

We'll make sure our discussions are easy to follow and packed with useful tips, so you can understand how these changes can benefit the construction industry in Africa. Join us for an enlightening journey into the future of construction in Africa! 

Topics to be covered include: 

  • Innovations in Building & Construction Materials 
  • Latest Trends in Sustainable Construction Materials in Africa 
  • Earthen Architecture 
  • Construction using 3D Technology

title: 8th CEE Hydrogen Summit
description:
Hydrogen has emerged as a key solution in the transition towards a low-carbon and sustainable energy future. With its ability to store and release energy, hydrogen offers a versatile and clean alternative to traditional fossil fuels. The CEE Hydrogen Summit aims to showcase the potential of hydrogen as a renewable energy source and discuss its applications across various sectors, including transportation, industry, power generation, and heating.

Participants can expect engaging presentations, insightful panel discussions, interactive workshops, and demonstrations of state-of-the-art hydrogen solutions.

title: 2025 Africa’s Green Economy Summit
description:
Get ready for Africa’s Green Economy Summit, where global capital meets African opportunity!

Now in its 3rd edition, this premier event bridges the gap between global investors, African governments, project owners, and business leaders, all united in driving an inclusive green economy across Africa. With a focus on connecting sectors, showcasing transformative projects, enabling partnerships, and facilitating funding commitments, the Summit is your gateway to shaping a climate-resilient Africa.

The 2025 theme, ‘Building a Climate Resilient Africa: Catalysing Investment and Innovation in the Green and Blue Economies,’ underscores the urgency and potential of our mission.

Join us on this transformative journey!

title: CIOB Student Festival 2025
description:
First established in 2021, The CIOB Student Festival is a dynamic and immersive gathering that brings together students, industry experts, thought leaders, and academics from diverse communities in the construction environment on a global scale. It serves as a platform for networking, collaborative learning and gaining insights into the latest trends, developments and future careers in the construction industry, all in one space.

  • Engage with industry leaders, as they share their experiences and perspectives on the future of construction.
  • Gain valuable insights into the challenges, innovations, and trends that are shaping our industry.
  • Connect with construction professionals, like-minded peers, and mentors from around the globe.
  • Learn from fellow students and graduates who will share their strategies for success in both academic and professional life.

title: InventU Fuel  Evolution Congress
description:
The congress serves as a strategic platform for policymakers, industry leaders, and innovators to drive advancements in sustainable fuels, explore regulatory developments, and accelerate the transition to a low-carbon future.

The event will feature four focused forums:

  • 5th Biogas Forum
  • 4th Sustainable Aviation Fuels Forum
  • 4th Biofuels Forum
  • 4th Sustainable Maritime Fuels Forum

title: 9th Green Hydrogen Forum
description:
Around the world, a green hydrogen rush is underway, and many companies, investors, governments, and environmentalists believe it is an energy source that could help end the reign of fossil fuels and slow the world's warming trajectory.

9th Edition Green Hydrogen Forum, featuring a high-level agenda, will bring together renewable power generators, project developers, debt providers and investors, government and private sector decision-makers, chemical and mobility industries representatives, gas grids and off-takers, among others, to define a new energy era fueled by hydrogen.

title: 11th Mozambique Mining and Energy Conference and Exhibition
description:
MMEC brings together key government representatives, top-performing mining, oil and gas, and energy companies, local stakeholders, development partners, established service providers and select investors keen to accelerate mining and energy investments in Mozambique and the region.

MMEC 2025 will run under the main theme, "Investing in a New Era: Transforming Mozambique's Natural Resources to Spur Industrialization and Regional Integration", underpinning the country's drive towards localized beneficiation and value addition of minerals, hydrocarbons and other natural resources to generate maximum value in-country and in the process achieve industrialization, intra-regional trade, and integration.

title: [CIOB] Understanding ESG fundamentals for construction and infrastructure
description:
We’ll explore how ESG reporting, carbon accounting, social value creation, and governance practices are reshaping development across infrastructure, housing, and urban planning.

Featuring expert insights from:

  • Khotso Mogotlane - Built environment specialist and ESG advocate
  • Hira Roohani - Sustainability and climate policy expert

Moderated by Tsebo Koena - Consulting engineer/Business Developer
